results.title: The Saddlemaker
results.creator_credit: Tim Wilson, ONF | NFB and Grant Crabtree
results.brief_description: From Alberta’s cowboy country, a story of a young girl’s first love, a saddle. Every saddle that leaves Felmer Eamor’s shop becomes a proud possession. In this film you sympathise with a fourteen-year-old girl’s wish to have such a saddle, and the bluff she pulls to get it.

results.title: The Saddle Club: horse crazy
results.creator_credit: Lynn Bayonas, Crawfords Australia, Protocol Entertainment, Chris Martin-Jones, Steve Mann and Mandy Smith
results.brief_description: An Australian/Canadian co-production, based on the best selling children and young adult series ‘The Saddle Club’ and ‘Pine Hollow’ written by Bonnie Bryant. Studious Lisa (Lara Jean Marshall), tomboy Stevie (Sophie Bennett) and horse-crazy Carole (Keenan Macwilliam) are the Saddle Club, best friends united by their love for horses and their willingness to help each other. A film crew use Pine Hollow as a location and rivalry stirs as the girls audition for a part. Can the leading man really ride a horse though? The girls in the club decide to help out so he doesn’t hurt ‘Comanche’. The dodgy wiring at Pine Hollow sends sparks into Max’s love life and the girls help him out with a makeover for his first date. The girls also get some fun-time too as they take part in a Rodeo weekend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn Bayonas, Crawfords Australia, Protocol Entertainment, Chris Martin-Jones, Steve Mann and Mandy Smith

results.title: The Saddle Club: friends forever
results.creator_credit: Lynn Bayonas, Crawfords Australia, Protocol Entertainment, Arnie Custo and Mark De Friest
results.brief_description: An Australian/Canadian co-production, based on the best selling children and young adult series ‘The Saddle Club’ and ‘Pine Hollow’ written by Bonnie Bryant. Studious Lisa (Lara Jean Marshall), tomboy Stevie (Sophie Bennett) and horse-crazy Carole (Keenan Macwilliam) are the Saddle Club, best friends united by their love for horses and their willingness to help each other. The arrival of the beautiful French Junior Champion, Dorothee Doutey (Matylda Buezko) creates a stir at Pine Hollow. What is her mystery behind her ‘rest’ and her disconnection from her horse ‘Hugo’? While the club try to remedy the situation another serious dilemma surfaces in the form of an unknown horse virus that threatens the stables. The club rally again to race against possible disaster. Will Dorothee take up her Olympic selection or settle on love with one of the stablehands? The girls also get to do their first singing performance in front of an audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn Bayonas, Crawfords Australia, Protocol Entertainment, Arnie Custo and Mark De Friest

results.title: The Saddle Club: adventures at Pine Hollow [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lynn Bayonas, Crawfords Australia, Protocol Entertainment, Chris Martin-Jones, Steve Mann and Peter Sharp
results.brief_description: An Australian/Canadian co-production, based on the best selling children and young adult series ‘The Saddle Club’ and ‘Pine Hollow’ written by Bonnie Bryant. Studious Lisa (Lara Jean Marshall), tomboy Stevie (Sophie Bennett) and horse-crazy Carole (Keenan Macwilliam) are the Saddle Club, best friends united by their love for horses and their willingness to help each other. Carole is offered the opportunity to be part of a work study program with the local vet, and is thrilled. Not only is being a vet her dream, but she can work with cute animals all day. Things don’t turn out as well as she plans and her confidence in her abilities drops. When spoilt rich-girl Veronica di Angelo’s negligence results in her horse Cobalt being put down, Carole is devastated and quits riding completely. Lisa and Stevie must work together to change their friend’s mind. They’ve already lost Cobalt, they don’t want to lose Carole too. Between riding, school and the dramas of pre-adolescence, the impending birth of a foal makes sure life at Pine Hollow is as chaotic as usual. Also available on VHS [315648].

results.title: The Sad clowns
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An examination of the different silent comedy styles of Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton and Harry Langdon. Excerpts from films show each actor on the threshold of their finest work. All three comedians give evidence of their ability to rise above the level of pure slapstick and develop a more personal style of comedy. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Sacrifice = Offret
results.creator_credit: Anna-Lena Wibom, Svenska filminstitutet, Sveriges Television Sveriges Television TV2, Argos Films, Channel Four and Andrei Tarkovsky
results.brief_description: Alexander, a retired actor, is in the midst of celebrating his birthday with his family when a radio announcement interrupts the party to warn of an imminent nuclear catastrophe. He makes a promise to God that he will sacrifice all he holds dear if the disaster can be averted. The next day dawns and everything seems to be restored to normality. Alexander must now keep his promise - or was it all a dream? Tarkovsky’s cinema has long dealt with the interpenetration of the seen and unseen worlds, visible manifestations of the spiritual battles that are continually being waged around us. By deliberately leaving his visionary images open-ended he hoped their meanings would continue to grow in the mind of the viewer. Tarkovsky died of cancer shortly after completing this film. (Awards: Grand Prix winner, Cannes Film Festival, 1986) In Swedish with English subtitles. Cast includes Erland Josephson, Susan Fleetwood, Valerie Mairesse and Allan Edwell.

results.title: The Sacred cow of India
results.creator_credit: Jim Dale, Mediacast and W.R. Geddes
results.brief_description: A striking feature of India is the prevalence of cows in all the cities and the tolerance and respect with which they are treated. This film traces the origin of the sacred cow concept showing how it is supported, not only by religion but by the practical value of cattle and their products. The story leads the viewer through scenes of bull wrestling in the South, the colourful rural Vishnoi people of Rajasthan, the giant cattle fair of Brahmin priests and the the Hari Krishna cult, and the elevation of cows to divine status.

results.title: The Rutles
results.creator_credit: Rutles, Craig Kellem, Gary Weis and Eric Idle
results.brief_description: The Rutles is a mockumentary, a parody of The Beatles and Beatlemania written and co-directed by Eric Idle, of Monty Python fame. The Rutles are Dirk, Barry, Stig and Nasty. Made for television, “The Rutles” charts the rise of the band of the same name as they progress from English obscurity to world phenomena. Using mockumentary footage and interviews, “The Rutles” documents the pre-fab four’s journey right through to their messy break up and post-Rutle lives. Idle plays a series of characters including Rutle Dirk and a hapless BBC type interviewer who narrates the film. “The Rutles” mocks the BBC, documentary filmmakers, and The Beatles’ films and music. Features excerpts from The Rutles films - Yellow Submarine Sandwich, Tragical History Tour, OUCH!, and A Hard Day’s Rut. Songs include Please rut me, All you need is cash and Twist and rut. “The Rutles” also features George Harrison, John Belushi, Dan Ackroyd, Bianca Jagger, Ron Wood, Mick Jagger, Paul Simon and Bill Murray. “The Rutles” is a sharp and witty send up of any number of documentaries made about The Beatles.

Using mockumentary footage and interviews, “The Rutles” documents the pre-fab four’s journey right through to their messy break up and post-Rutle lives. Idle plays a series of characters including Rutle Dirk and a hapless BBC type interviewer who narrates the film. “The Rutles” mocks the BBC, documentary filmmakers, and The Beatles’ films and music. Features excerpts from The Rutles films - Yellow Submarine Sandwich, Tragical History Tour, OUCH!, and A Hard Day’s Rut. Songs include Please rut me, All you need is cash and Twist and rut. “The Rutles” also features George Harrison, John Belushi, Dan Ackroyd, Bianca Jagger, Ron Wood, Mick Jagger, Paul Simon and Bill Murray. “The Rutles” is a sharp and witty send up of any number of documentaries made about The Beatles.
description_for_label: The Rutles is a mockumentary, a parody of The Beatles and Beatlemania written and co-directed by Eric Idle, of Monty Python fame. The Rutles are Dirk, Barry, Stig and Nasty. Made for television, “The Rutles” charts the rise of the band of the same name as they progress from English obscurity to world phenomena. Using mockumentary footage and interviews, “The Rutles” documents the pre-fab four’s journey right through to their messy break up and post-Rutle lives. Idle plays a series of characters including Rutle Dirk and a hapless BBC type interviewer who narrates the film. “The Rutles” mocks the BBC, documentary filmmakers, and The Beatles’ films and music. Features excerpts from The Rutles films - Yellow Submarine Sandwich, Tragical History Tour, OUCH!, and A Hard Day’s Rut. Songs include Please rut me, All you need is cash and Twist and rut. “The Rutles” also features George Harrison, John Belushi, Dan Ackroyd, Bianca Jagger, Ron Wood, Mick Jagger, Paul Simon and Bill Murray. “The Rutles” is a sharp and witty send up of any number of documentaries made about The Beatles.
